snippet: Priceline’s “name your own price” feature is not perfect, but its deals on hotel rooms can be worth the effort.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column contends Priceline’s 'name your own price' feature is not perfect, but its deals on hotel rooms can be worth the effort; notes firm is de-emphasizing that part of its business, even though blind bidding still accounts for most of its hotel bookings in the United States; notes Priceline is emphasizing its segment that publishes discount prices before reservations.
lead_paragraph: Priceline’s “name your own price” feature is not perfect, but its deals on hotel rooms can be worth the effort.

headline.print_headline: Leap of Faith Can Land A Good Hotel Deal
headline.seo: Hotel Bookings and the Educated Guess
headline.main: Leap of Faith Can Land a Good Hotel Deal
